intro: Geanthus calycinus, commonly known as the silverleaf geanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking a unique and drought-tolerant plant.
